column8:
Nissan Tour of Ireland, 1986.

Sean Kelly and Steve Bauer contest the sprint in the final stage.

Sean Kelly had to beat Steve Bauer in the final stage in O'Connell Street, Dublin. Bauer was in yellow with a lead of just 3 seconds over Kelly. Provided Kelly beat Bauer and was in the top three he would take a time bonus that would deliver overall victory. The picture, courtesy of Phil O'Connor's 21 years of Cycling Photography, has Kelly doing the necessary with Bauer inches behind him.

 

Sean Kelly was the most successful classics winner of the 80's: 4 times winner of the TdF points jersey and five times a stage winner. Seven time consecutive winner of Paris Nice, three times a winner of the Tour of Lombardy and The Criterium International. Twice a winner of: Liege-Bastogne-Liege, Paris-Roubaix, Milan-SanRemo , Tour de Suisse and four times a winner of the Nissan Tour of Ireland. And once a winner of of the Vuelta and the UCI World Road Race World Cup. Apart from being a formidable sprinter he was a notably fearless descender. Not least for this dash down the Poggio for his last major victory in the Milan-San Remo.
